titleStmt.title: [Legal Quits of Claim and Registration Certification] 1814 -1816 [for] James Hamilton of Davidson County, Tennessee and William Anderson of Lexington County Ky : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Legal Quits of Claim and Registration Certification] 1814 -1816 [for] James Hamilton of Davidson County, Tennessee and William Anderson of Lexington County Ky
bibl.note: These are three different documents. The first one is dated Dec. 15, 1814, and is written by James Hamilton. It is a quit of claim of the Cherokee/African slaves that his brother in law, Joseph Brown took back from the Cherokee Chief Cotetoy. The slaves were descendents of a slave named Sue that was owned by Hamilton's father in law (Joseph Brown's father), James Brown, and stolen by Cotetoy. The second paper is the registration certification for said quit, written by Joseph Porter in May 1816. The third paper is dated Dec. 15, 1814. It is a quit of claim to two slaves, Jinney and Suey, and offspring, by William Anderson. He also states that Joseph Brown has payed him $150 for the portion of James Brown's estate that Anderson inherited.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: Know all Men by these preasents that I James Hamilton of the State of Tennessee and County of Davidson have and by these preasents quit Claim to Certain Negroes (Viz) JinneySueyJainney Newchous Tannenole Senelaca Dorusendey & Omiah Certain Negroes Recovered by Joseph Brown from the Cherokee Indiens a part of the property taken by said Cherokee Indiens from My father in law James Brown Deceased and as I Neaver have Recev.d aney part of Said Estate since the Death of said Deceased and Will Not be accountable for aney Demand against said Estate I therefore quit all Claim to aney part of the said Negroes and Do Warrent and Defend the same from my Haire or assigne to the other Ligation of Said Estate as to me or my Haire Witness my hand & seal 15th December 1814 Test
div1.signed: George W Chartton James Hamilton sealMilberry Hamilton Samuel TarnerAcknowledged by James Hamilton July 9th 1815 Joseph B. Porter I was

div1.head: quit Claim of Indian Negroes to Joseph Brown Entired
State of Tennessee Maury County May Term 1816
div1.p: when th within quit claim deed was Exhibited into open Court and the Execution thereof duly proven by the oath of Milberry Hamilton & Subscrybing witness thereto and ordered to be certifiyed for rigistration

Know all Men by these preasents that I William Anderson of the state of Kaintucky& County Lexington Do as an Hair of the Estate of James Brown Deceased quit all Claim to two Negro Wemen & their family (Viz Jinney & Suey & their offspring unto Joseph Brown and the other ligatures of said Estate as the said Joseph Brown has this Day payed me one Hundred & fifty Dollars it being my proportional part of said Estate the Receipt Whereof is hearby acknowledged Witness My hand and seal 15th December 1814
div1.signed: James Hamilton Wm Anderson seal Milberry Hamilton
